author: CallmeJoeBob
body:
## PR Summary

GitHub requires TLS version 1.2 or greater, whereas Windows PowerShell ships with an older version of TLS. This sets the TLS version to use 1.2.

Resolves https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/issues/6233

comments.author: markekraus
comments.body:
Woah wait.. why was this merged so quickly?

Changing this setting without changing it back is a very bad idea. This affects way more than just the current execution scope. It will break access to systems in the current PowerShell session.

At the very least this should have been done instead:

```powershell
[Net.ServicePointManager]::SecurityProtocol = [Net.ServicePointManager]::SecurityProtocol -bor [Net.SecurityProtocolType]::Tls12
```

That way access to older systems in the same session wont mysterious;y break.

/cc @SteveL-MSFT @TravisEz13 @iSazonov @daxian-dbw
